Class Moon

java.lang.Object
CelestialObject
Moon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Moon extends CelestialObject
A Moon object is one that orbits around a host Planet in 2D space. Like a Planet, a Moon also has a changing velocity. Each Planet can only have up to 2 Moons associated with it, assuming a standard implementation of KeyboardPressHandler in SolarSystemPanel
Since:
3/28/2021
Author:
Austin Piper

  • Field Details

    • hostPlanet

      private Planet hostPlanet
      A reference to the Planet which the current Moon orbits around

    • orbital_radius

      private int orbital_radius
      The radius of orbit which the Moon has around its Host Planet

    • t

      private int t
      The Moon's velocity is determined using a set of parametric equations. This is the parametric variable.
      See Also:
      update()

  • Constructor Details

    • Moon

      public Moon​(Planet input_hostPlanet, int input_radius, int input_orbital_radius)
      Parameters:
      input_hostPlanet - A reference to the Planet which will be the Moon's host
      input_radius - The physical size of the new Moon within 2D space
      input_orbital_radius - The radius of orbit which the new Moon has around its host Planet

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the Moon's position within 2D space. It first sets the Moon itself relative to the host Planet, then adjust this position to reflect the Moon's position within its orbit.
      Specified by:
      update in class CelestialObject
